title: Event-driven architecture
summary: Use events to decouple domains and integration capabilities, enabling independent change and scalable processing.

decisionGuidance.problemSolved: Broker-style integration centralizes change and hides complexity, slowing modernization and increasing outages.
whenToUse: Workloads include batch, files, and async processing
whenNotToUse: You only have simple, single-consumer flows and do not intend to scale

gotchas: Lack of tracing makes troubleshooting painful
thingsToWatchOutFor.opinionatedGuidance: EDA is a discipline: business events, versioning, observability, idempotency, and DLQ governance.

complexity.rationale: EDA introduces distributed behavior but enables long-term scalability.
complexity.skillDemand: Distributed systems and event modeling skill.

realWorldExample.approach: Moved core signals to events and migrated flows incrementally.
realWorldExample.outcome: Faster change and reduced integration breakage.
